cyclone.name: OMAR
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles south-southwest of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northeast, then east-northeast, remaining offshore of the North Carolina coast and moving into the open Atlantic.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer Banks and portions of the North Carolina coastline mainly east of Cape Lookout affected by high surf and rip currents.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible as outer rainbands brush the coast; sustained tropical-storm winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor water‐level rises along immediate beaches possible with persistent onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered showers, generally under 1–2 inches total near Wilmington.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will pose a threat to port personnel working near open beaches or jetties.
